11212.content:
“If it’s alright with you, I’ll leave her here, I need the rest anyway.”


Hearing those words come out from her new friend’s mouth almost made Jeanine squeal in delight, she’d get not two but three little girls to fatten full time, but there was still another question she had for Mary,

“Would you like to try feeding her? See if you want to come over every so often, either to watch or stuff her yourself?”

After a bit of internal debate, Mary assented,

“Well, why not? I am wondering what it’s like.”

“Great, get Ashley onto one of the chairs and use the zip ties to make sure she can’t escape. There should be some more cakes in the fridge or cupboards, if there’s enough grab two, I still have Clara to feed anyway.”

Leaving her friend for a moment while she went out to the yard to grab her other daughter, a disgustingly athletic little girl with an odd love for exercise, even now the tot was having fun running around in the grass. Not caring much of the girl’s opinion, Jeanine deftly picked her up and headed back inside to the kitchen, once there Clara was quickly placed in and secured to one of the unoccupied chairs, startled by the abruptness that this absurd situation had, the girl started to tear up, then soon started crying.

This added to the return of her friend led Mary to break out of her reverie, stopping her desire fueled barrage of baked good and giving her daughter a chance to breathe or if she was in any state to cry, fortunately for the mothers’ ears, it seemed Ashley was in no state to manage anything other than a soft whimper. Clara was another story, deciding she’d rather enjoy shutting her twig of a daughter up, Jeanine unceremoniously shoved a handful of cake into the young athlete’s weeping face, filling the girl’s mouth enough to nearly cause her to choke, she didn’t, though she still tried to escape, which of course was futile her mother had learned from what Alice attempted, now even the girl’s hair was secured between the gaps in the chair’s back, effectively immobilizing her and only managed to increase her discomfort.

As the cake was methodically being pressed down the tot’s throat, Jeanine started thinking over why she was doing this, and the more she thought about it, the less sure she was of her own motive. Was she actually enjoying her revenge itself this much? Or was it something more? Was it really her daughters that she hated, or only their sizes? The answer to these questions wasn’t known, at least not now, but Jeanine didn’t terribly care, no matter the reason, she’d still fatten her daughters to probable immobility. Grabbing another handful, she got back to feeding…
11212.title: Full time fattening.

112121.content:
Coming back to her senses, Mary thought about what she’d just done, not to mention just how much she’d enjoyed the twisted activity. Honestly, she had doubts about whether or not she could hide this from her husband. Thankfully it shouldn’t prove much of a problem, the man was always away at work after all. As for the victim of her recent action, Ashley was utterly incapacitated by the swollen lump that had occupied her lithe middle. Though as could be expected, the perpetrator wasn’t feeling remorse, rather trying to think of a way to fit even more into the overfilled toddler. It took a bit of pondering, but the newly obsessed mother soon realized what she could do; liquids, she could fill any remaining room with fluid.

Wasting no time, she promptly started to look for a decently sized funnel, and eventually found one in a kitchen drawer. After she pushed its end into the unfortunate child’s mouth, Mary went over to look through Jeanine’s fridge. She found something promising easily enough, a carton of heavy cream. Once she’d grabbed it, the fluid was soon poured into poor Ashley’s mouth, finding its way inside her stomach and soaking into the densely packed contents. Watching the spectacle, one could only pity the child. It was obvious that this would soon become a regular occurrence given her mother’s infatuation with it.

Jeanine, who’d since finished feeding her daughter, saw what her friend was doing and felt a twisted sort of pride, having watched and encouraged the young mother from mild curiosity to the current potential obsession. The newly stuffed Clara, now having a chance to breathe, winced as it led her stomach’s contents to shift, the food threatening to escape. Stubbornly though, the three-year-old held it in, if only out of fear for what might happen if she didn’t. Once she’d managed to retain her middle’s occupants, the unfortunate girl soon fell into a food coma, falling limp in her restraints.

Looking over, Jeanine noticed that Mary had finished feeding Ashley, the girl left doing little more than breathing, raggedly at that. Moving toward her new friend and accomplice, she mused, “What do you want to do now? Can’t expect to fit much more into them, at least not for a while.”

“I guess we could watch some television or something… Maybe I could tell you more about myself. Since I don’t remember saying much about me, and given what just happened, I’m wondering whether we share anything else in common.”

“Why not? And do you want anything to eat, since there should still be some food in the fridge or cupboards?”

“Sure, I could go for some lunch after that. It doesn’t need to be anything special, but I wouldn’t mind getting a taste of your cooking.”

Chuckling, Jeanine replied, “Alright, you go ahead and get settled in the living room or somewhere. I’ll have it ready in a minute.”

As promised, after a short ten minutes, the mother brought her friend a simple plate of leftovers, specifically, some of the remaining roast from the night before. Still, it wasn’t as if reheating food did much to the quality, giving her no qualms about handing it to her guest. Though there was only a moment before she tried to spark the conversation, “Well, fire away, what was it you wanted to ask me?”

“Well, for starters, I guess; What’s your job? If you have one, that is.”

“Oh, well, I’m a model, though I’m starting to put more attention toward my fashion line.”

“Really? Wait," She started, "so that’s why you looked vaguely familiar. Why aren’t you modeling as much now, though?”

“I’ve just been feeling like I’ve lost my touch, two kids would take their toll after all.”

“Well, if it means anything, you haven’t changed at all, in my opinion.”

“Thanks, but you’re not the only one who’s explained that to me. Even my competition was adamant about that. Still, for one reason or another, some of my confidence is gone, or maybe I subconsciously want to retire, among other things. But what about you?”

“Not much to say really, I’m a housewife, had to keep little Ashley out of trouble all the time, after all, part of why I’ll be glad if she ends up too large to move around much. Though I’ll still have to take care of her obviously, not as if she’ll be able to manage anything independently once I’m done.”

Smiling from what she’d heard, Jeanine added her piece to the conversation, “Well, my husband is similar with his work schedule, but he’s the type of man to try and get as many family days as reasonably possible, sometimes more. Which, while being one of the things I love about him, makes it awkward to try and fatten up our daughters without his notice.”

“Oh, I guess it’s good, for this scenario at least, that his hours are the way they are. It’d be even more difficult to force your children into obesity if he was home every night, right?”

“That’s true, but it probably won’t go over well. So, to try and keep the most problematic events from happening, I’ll just have to break them before Greg manages to notice anything going on.”

And so, the two went, gossiping about who-and-who or such-and-such until one of them finally noticed the time, realizing that it was time to head home, but maybe it’d be better to stuff them again first?

114.content:
With those words, Alice did as anyone could expect; she ignored them. Violently so to a point, jerking her body and limbs in desperate, worthless attempts to deny her mother’s intentions. Not that it did much, both her legs already restrained, yet it was annoying none the less, enough so to provoke more than a simple demand.


“Stop that would you?” Jeannine started, having gotten a hold on both of the one-year-old's arms, “I guess I was wrong to hope you’d try eating by yourself.”


Following the statement, the pair of limbs were pulled behind their owner’s back, soon bound together despite their tugs toward freedom. Still, the experience was none too comfortable, Alice made even more opposed to the treatment as her shoulders started to strain, burning lightly from the position they were forced into. Unfortunately, it seemed her mother didn’t care, all but ignoring the toddler’s plight as she continued, giving a hint as to what refusal will accomplish.


“Now then,” It came, along with the first forkful being brought near her lips, “I’m expecting you to eat what I feed you, though honestly, it may go faster if you resist. So, make sure you’ve thought a moment before doing anything, I won’t be giving you any more than the one chance.”


“Huh?” Was what the child most likely meant, but with the cake-bite pushed inside her mouth, it was closer to “Hfh!” than anything intelligible. Though, even despite that, the young girl couldn’t help herself from letting out a “No!” once she was given the chance, earning no more than a glare from her mother and a second forkful, momentarily stifling any complaints. Still, Jeannine was a tad bored, wanting the result more so than the process, so she decided to see if her daughter would do anything helpful to pass the time given the chance. So, pausing in her actions for the moment, she waited to see if any entertainment might come out of the uncooperative mouth.

In the end, after a few more, yet equally useless “Huh”s, “No”s, “Stop”s, and other such pleas, there was finally something that might relieve a touch of the parent’s ennui; “Why?”


With that, alongside the smile growing on her face, Jeannine explained the simple, somewhat childish reason, “Why am I doing this? Well, sweetie, it’s because of you and your sister, both of you running around and playing forces daddy to focus on you rather than mommy. Understand?”


“I...” Sounded the expected plea, falling, like every other, on deafened ears.


Somehow understanding the girl's unspoken claim, it continued, “But then what will daddy think? And what would stop you from telling daddy about me threatening you?”


“I-I good. Please.” Continued the attempts, the words simply meaning nothing despite their honesty.


“Sweetie, don’t bother, just eat. You and I both know you’d tell daddy the first chance you got, now wouldn’t you?”


“N-No...”


“I’m sure you wouldn’t, but there’s no reason for me not to make extra sure, isn’t that right?” Jeannine teased, finally bringing another bite to her youngest’s lips, making sure they were chewing before she continued, “Now, I don’t want to be mean and leave you in suspense, so give me a moment and I’ll show you an example of how big you’ll be getting. Okay?”


Leaving the toddler there, though it was closer to dropping Alice’s head into the cake in hopes of her eating a few more bites by herself, the woman moved into the kitchen, getting out a bit more food before picking up the previously paused tv. So, carrying the device with her, the mother returned to her one-and-a-half-year-old, setting the machine in front of her before remembering what should’ve been obvious, her other child, Pheobe, would be coming home shortly, the nine-year-old was only at school after all.

One might expect that with that, Jeannine might find a change of heart, born from the worrying possibility of being unable to involve the third-grader in her plans. Not to mention the questions she might be asked if the child suddenly grew obese throughout a single school year, what with her known love of soccer. Oddly though, if potentially caused by a bit of short-sightedness from the mother, she didn’t seem to care, only pondering how hard it’ll be to make her fill out, as she lacked the convenience Alice had, the toddler never leaving the house without her mother.

Still, she didn’t dwell on it, naïve as that decision may be, instead finishing what she’d meant to do in the first place. So, finally pulling her unfortunate daughter’s face from the baked good, the tormentor directed the poor girl’s gaze to the television, briefly rewinding the program before it started, making sure that every moment of the footage found its way into their mind. And, if Alice’s resumed squirming was any indication, it was doing that quite well, the toddler overwhelmed as she already was by the feeding itself, was left to her own, useless devices as she unwilling watched what she knew was intended to be a premonition of her future. Not to mention, her mother’s commentary wasn’t helping.


“Look, honey, don’t you like how big Jordan is?” One of them came, picking and choosing between any of the episode’s centerpieces, “Doesn’t it look fun to be so large you could barely fit on an average couch?”


“Or what about Lucy? I doubt that little whale ever actually learned to walk, now, how long do you think there’ll be until you can’t?”


“Oh! And then there’s Ashlynn, poor girl, she was so big before that surgery. But don’t worry, you can be sure I’ll never force such a thing on you, okay?"


So, along with all of that, Alice simply began to cry, the tears only continuing to flow when her eyed were delicately wiped, her mother brushing the droplets away. Not from the good of her heart mind you, no, it was plainly because Jeannine refused to let her child miss any part of the talk show, thinking it might help them, if nothing else, come to terms with what their future would look like. Nonetheless, the show had to end at some point, and when it did, the one-and-a-half-year-old quickly found her mouth prompted with a bite, her parent yet unsatisfied with her consumption.

She also wanted to camp but her parents told her she was a bit too young for that. She also liked playing with Kiekie. Kiekie was her little 6-month-old sister. She didn't look like her sister. Kiekie was blond, totally not into sports and kind of fat. Probably because her mother put a bit of extra fatty sweeteners in her milk. Rebecca saw her mother do it but didn't think anything of it.

         The reason her mother (her name was Jennifer) put the fatty sweetener stuff in the milk because she always loved fat girls. She was a fat girl herself years ago and loved it, but her mother forced her to diet and she did. She lost a lot of weight. But even while her mother and she never agreed about the weight they still loved each other and she had very good contact with her mother her whole life. Not that she didn't eat meat or grains. She did but she loved fruit and vegetables more. With a diet mostly filled with fruit and vegetables, you didn't gain much. 1331.content:
So, interrupt something did, as for what, the audible knocking for a room over was a good enough indicator. The noise bringing the previously lost smile back onto Rebecca’s face, whoever was at the door would help her, surely. They’d make her mother stop her strange actions and go back to how she’d been before, kind, loving, well, motherly. Though, there was a slight hiccup in those expectations, what with Jennifer’s face being nothing like the sort one might have if they were confused, rather, the grin plastered on her face was much like one of happiness instead. If of the sort that fed on another’s despair.


Thus, as could be predicted, the mother only gave a short, “One moment dear.” as she went over to the door, not forgetting to shove another spoonful in her child’s mouth before she did.


With that, the four-year-old was left to ponder, not being capable of much else given her bindings, and possibly worry about just who it was at the door. Though it was obvious that it was nothing good, she’d have been set free in any other case after all, yet still, just who could it be at the door, none of her mother’s friends were like this, as far as Rebecca knew of course, but then who was left? Well, admittedly it didn’t really matter, the poor four-year-old wasn’t likely to be freed or help by anyone her captor went to see with such a pleased attitude. Mentally grumbling about her horrid situation, she waited, dreaded, for her parent’s return, all the more anxious about who the new arrival would be.

Unfortunately, the toddler was stuck facing that person in only a few minutes, the light conversation between the two friends momentarily coming to an end, the pair did need to get on with what they planned to. For what that happened to be, it wasn’t too different from what had been preceding the arrival, it still involved stuffing the girls they had nearby as much as would prove doable, not to mention as often as they could manage to do it, stomach capacities permitting of course. Still, there should be some introduction of who that collaborator was.

For starters, they, she, was a woman, one roughly around Jennifer’s age at that, if possibly a tad younger. She didn’t stand on ceremony though, explaining her presence to the girl after a short chat with her partner.


“Hey there dearie, I’m Rachel, a friend of your mom’s. And just like her, I’m disappointed by how little meat you have on your bones, just look at you. You can barely even fill such a small chair, but don’t worry your little head about it, I’m sure we’ll be able to fix that up quickly.”


“But I like how I am.”


“I’m sorry dear,” the woman continued, soon losing her friendliness, “though I guess I should remind you. We never asked for your opinion, okay?”


“W-Why?”


“What do you mean why? You’ll look so much cuter when we’re done. For the moment though, we’ll have to work on your eating. And please, don’t bother trying to wiggle away, alright?”


Expectably, the intended victim wasn’t about to just simply agree, though really, that implies the toddler was even given a chance to. Rather than the reality of a slice of cake being pushed against, and into, her mouth, having been taken from the frosted good sitting in the middle of the table. To her credit, Rebecca still did as expected, trying to twist her head and mouth away from the food, but there were issues with that, as anyone could anticipate. One of those problems was Rachel’s seeming... experience with the activity, odd that may be. For where that conclusion came from, it would be the unexpectedly practiced nature of the woman’s actions, either where she gripped her victim’s chin when they attempted to turn away, or the immediate decisions to pinch the child’s side whenever the next bite was refused. Uncaring toward the discomfort it plainly brought the girl.

As for what the girl’s mother had occupied herself with, it was simply her youngest, the purely cooperative baby more than happy to chug down the bottle she was fed. Once she’d woken up, it didn’t take long for Rebecca to notice that something was wrong. Having found herself in the kitchen, zip-tied to a chair no less, any hope she held of the experience being a bad dream died. Soon having replaced itself with a mixture of dread and fear. The cause of which was happily humming while toiling over the stove. Making sure there was an excessive number of calories ready and waiting to be stuffed down her daughter’s gullet. Having heard the child’s initial shuffling, Jennifer walked over and whispered in the terrified girl’s ear,

“Don’t bother resisting, regardless of how much you try stopping it you’re going to end up the blob I want you to be. So, make it easier for yourself, try to enjoy it... and don’t worry about exercise. I’m not expecting you to move except for moving to the bathroom and back, be sure to expect more food if you decide to try exercising otherwise.”

Leaving her daughter there with that revelation. Jennifer left the room to go get Kiekie from her crib, picking up the chubby six-month-old and enjoying how the girl’s body squished in her arms. Being such a deep sleeper, the pudgy baby only woke up once the scent of food reached her nose. Before starting to whine and reach toward it, desperate to begin eating. Unlike her all too willing sister, Rebecca was still dumbfounded by what her mother had promised her. All the more with the realization that there was nothing she could do to keep it from becoming her reality. The poor girl only managed to stare blankly as Jennifer set out the spread of food she’d cooked for her piglets.

After the food was set out, Kiekie was quickly sated with a large bottle of formula and heavy cream. Rebecca, on the other hand, was still unresponsive but came back to reality once her mother started pushing food into her mouth. Being reminded of how soon the future she’d been promised was to be. Other than the start, the feeding wasn’t terribly remarkable, being merely the pattern of, grab food, feed, repeat, and only stopped once Rebecca had fallen into a food coma. As one might now expect from Jennifer, the first thing she checked wasn’t if her daughter was okay. Instead, it was the amount of food that she’d managed to fit into her eldest’s stomach. Said organ was tinted an unpleasant red, straining itself to hold the excessive amount of densely caloric mass that had been forced into it.

With Rebecca now incapacitated, the girls’ mother could now focus on her youngest, Kiekie, not that she needed to do much. The girl conveniently took every opportunity to stuff herself, wanting only to please her mother and satisfy her own gluttony. Regardless, once her daughter finished her appetizer, Jennifer started grabbing food from what remained of the pile on the table. After collecting a decent portion of the spread, she started pressing it into the baby’s waiting face. Happily watching the girl blissfully consume any and all food put in front of her maw. All too willing to fulfill the role her mother meant for them.

Nevertheless, the moment was somewhat bittersweet, given how well her youngest fit into her desires, for what reason did Rebecca so adamantly refuse? Even though she’d understand some resistance on the girl’s part to gaining weight, she couldn’t think of a reason for her to do so with such vehemence. If Rebecca was older and more focused on popularity or the “Thin is in” lifestyle, it’d be understandable. But there shouldn’t be any reason for a four-year-old to resist her mother so desperately. Musing, Jennifer thought that if there was anything good to come from that, it would be how simple she expected it to be to break the girl. One thorough dose of helplessness should prove enough, if not, then there was all the more fun to be had.

Looking at her young, though surprisingly inquisitive, daughter Jennifer realized that she might as well tell her, not as if her desires were a secret at this point. Anyway, if she heard her reasoning, the girl might give up the resistance which, though futile, was annoying.

“Well… there’s not much to say really, one assumption you could make is that it’s because I don’t care, yet that’s not quite true. Instead, It’s because I believe that happiness is more important than health, and therefore, my happiness is more important than your health. Not that I want you to get hurt, of course, but I’ll cross that bridge when we get to it. Is that a good enough answer, Rebecca? Or not quite the response you were hoping for?”

Hearing that, Rebecca could do little more than stare back in shock. She’d hoped that her mother just hadn’t realized and would stop as soon as she learned that it would hurt her daughters, she’d put an end to it. Instead, she got, well what did she get? There wasn’t much other than a depressing, seemingly concrete statement. Regardless of its effects, they would be as fat as their captor could make them. But honestly, what could she, a four-year-old, do about it?

She could fight it to the best of her ability, but to what end? It wasn’t as if the girl still expected her mother to suddenly flip and apologize, so what did she expect her resistance to accomplish? Perhaps a helpful stranger to tell her mother off and take them to freedom? Unfortunately, the more she thought and tried to hope, the more certain her fate seemed. The only hope she had left was that her mother stopped before they were too afflicted.

Unsurprisingly, she hadn’t taken a bite while she’d thought and despaired, yet it wasn’t as if her mother hadn’t noticed. Already having set down her nearly comatose niece as she moved closer to her daughter. Possibly because of the shock, Rebecca didn’t resist much of the feeding at first, chewing and swallowing whatever pressed against her mouth. But as her stomach filled, she slowly started to struggle, likely prompted by the pain of overfullness.

Even with the resistance, the toddler was now posing, one couldn’t honestly expect Jennifer to stop because of something so feeble. The only thing the girl’s actions actually did was bring a little bit of amusement for her mother. Introducing a slight spice to the otherwise somewhat monotonous activity of feeding. Still, despite how much the two children had been made to eat, plenty was left on the table. Food which would hopefully make its way into, then onto, the children’s bodies.

On and on it went, at some point Rebecca again gave up, meekly opening her mouth when prompted, then swallowing the mouthful of food. So far, she’d managed to choke down a good portion of a cake, but it wasn’t as if that was all Jennifer planned to force into the girl. Though regardless of what she wanted, there was only so much room in her daughter’s stomach. Now starting to tint pink from how much it presently carried.

It was mere minutes later that Rebecca had been thoroughly stuffed, middle stretched to the point of shining, yet her mother still wasn’t satisfied. Nevertheless, she stopped, she’d known how much patience this would require, though it was hard to resist when it was so close to being realized. Sighing, the woman wistfully imagined the future she was wholeheartedly working toward, the young harem of flab that she could feed, dominate, and do God knew what else to. Yet that would take time, she hoped not too long, though as the saying went, “Rome wasn’t built in a day.”

“...the fattest sow a fair could ever host.”

Regardless of whether Christine was considered smart for her age, in this situation, she was only very, very confused. Once those words crossed her ears though, nothing changed, aside from her confusion, steadily converting itself into dread that is. The poor girl’s mental state was already a none too happy cocktail of fear and befuddlement, in no small part due to the cake which had been shoved down her throat. Truly, Jennifer had no reason to be surprised by the inevitable retaliation, or the attempt at least.

As for what that was, it should seem obvious to anyone who’s had to care for a young child, sibling, or such. In simple terms, little Christine had decided that trying to scream would be the answer. Unfortunately, the reverse held, at least if one went by how quickly the tot’s aunt shoved another clump of cake into the conveniently open mouth. Filling it with more of the frosted dough, though a decent portion of the icing missed its mark, smearing across her face.

Inevitably, Jennifer ran into an unsurprising obstacle; the girl was full. Not to say that stopped her, nothing of the sort, instead she was encouraged by it, knowing that every extra morsel she managed to get her niece to eat was another stretching her stomach. Still, she thought it was time enough for her to start the day’s work of breaking the girl in, she had her role to play of course.

Leaning closer to the toddler’s ear, she whispered her first demands, “Squeal my piglet, go on. Let’s keep you oinking until it’s all that you can manage, and don’t think about refusing, I’m sure you can think of a few reasons not to.”

After that, the aunt lifted her overstuffed niece from her chair, adjusting the rope to bind her hands, of course. And, for whatever the reason, proceeded to set her onto the kitchen floor. The explanation came soon enough, Jennifer moving a pet bowl, a memento of their old pet, filled with food to the ground in front of the girl, obviously meaning for her to consume it. Still, it took a moment, and a forceful “Eat!” before the toddler began, forced to feed directly from the saucer.

That wasn’t to say Rebecca had no qualms about what was happening to her cousin, but what could she expect to do? Nothing seemed to be the answer. It wasn’t helped by her seeming inability to move from her seat on the couch, forced to watch the unnervingly dehumanizing scene from a safe distance away. And a spectacle it was; little Christine hadn’t exactly had any moments to calm down from her sobbing, let alone time to do it now, which lead to the possible metaphor of eating her tears, they’d all started falling into her new bow after all.

Somewhere in the middle of this, Rebecca had dropped her gaze, unable to comprehend what she’d witnessed. For Jennifer, though, she wasn’t going to make this any more pleasant for her niece, affectionately stroking the distraught toddler's back while she ate, petting her in a sense. Looking down at Christine, she muses over how far she wants to go, helpfully, the two-year-old spoke, not that anybody would understand them, but it was more than enough.

Croaking out from the child came the oh so expectable question of “Why?” though it sounded more like a high-pitched grunt than a word, being the reasonable woman she was, Jennifer gave her another chance; “What was that?”

Choking down her current mouthful, Christine piped up again though her tears, “Why? Please stop!”

“Was that... speech? Did you already forget what you were told?”

“H-Huh?”

“You did, didn’t you,” The aunt started with a small sigh, “Well, guess I’ll have to repeat it: You don’t need to know how to speak anymore, let alone do it. So, now, do as you’re meant to and act like the swine I want you to be.”

“..."

Seeing the look on the child’s face, she amends, “I won’t repeat it.”

“O-Oink?”

“Good girl. Now, keep eating. We wouldn’t want any of your food to go to waste, now would we?” She finished, calmly forcing Christine’s head back to where it should be, eating from her bowl.

Back with Rebecca, the toddler had begun to realize she should be counting her blessings if you could call them that. As it was undeniable that she was treated better than her cousin, she was treated like a human being, after all, allowed to talk and eat at the table instead of a pet dish. Still, the spectacle planted fear in her mind, “Will... no. How long until I’m treated like that?” But a coinciding question terrified her all the more, “Why am I... curious?”

Thankfully, Jennifer hadn’t noticed her daughter watching, let alone the intrigue budding in the girl’s mind, so, for now, she was safe if you could call it that. So, like anyone trying to put something out of their mind, the four-year-old sought to distract herself. Focusing on the cartoon playing across the screen, she pushed thoughts of the future out of her mind.

“Jennifer?”

“I told you to calm down. Just do your job and keep Kiekie fed. Questioning me isn’t part of that.” Jennifer reminded, rudely shutting down any unasked questions.

With that, the mother looked out the rear as she backed out of the driveway, setting off for a place that would likely bring a smile to most people’s faces; a pet store. Jennifer didn’t keep that a secret from them, knowing that Rebecca always enjoyed seeing all the birdies, bunnies, kitties, and puppies that the store had to offer. And still, the certainty may force Christine to accept it easier, not that she had any choice in the matter either way. So, focusing on the road, the woman spoke to those behind her,

“Alright, girls, this might be a slight surprise, but we’re stopping by a pet store. And no promises, so don’t get attached while you’re there, but the possibility of bringing home a new friend exists as long as Rebecca agrees to some conditions.”

“What conditions?” Came the given reply, the child expecting a much more cooperative answer than what she was given.

“That’s for me to decide. I might mention some while we’re there, but that doesn’t make those the only ones.” Pausing as her daughter listened, “I’m sure you can predict a few of them though, it’s not like it’ll be anything contradicting what you’ve experienced so far.”

After that, a slightly awkward silence filled the car, with the only human noise coming from Jennifer an ecstatic humming that did little to ease the younger riders’ nerves. Thankfully, they didn’t have to worry for unbearably long in that regard, as their destination wasn’t very far in the first place, promising that they arrived within a half-hour. Once they had, Nancy was quickly forced to watch both Rebecca and her little sister, their mother, already rushing off with Christine in arm.

So, for the time being, the pair and trio went their somewhat separate ways, though Nancy had to admit she didn’t mind the surroundings herself. Still, it was obvious that her friend was the one enjoying herself the most, excitedly looking at the selection as she carried her niece around. Occasionally, she pulled one of the collars of their rack to check how it’d look against her slave. Sometimes the aunt even entertained the thought of forcing Christine to stay in a full harness through the day, thinking it might help her learn her new, temporary method of movement.

Rebecca and co were having fun for entirely different reasons. The five-year-old was ecstatic at the change of scenery, happily playing with the available gerbils, rabbits, and even being momentarily amazed by the large tortoise the store had wandering around. For the time being, the child was almost in her own little paradise, especially with the drastic shift involving the spectacle from less than an hour ago. All the while, she was slightly failing her mother’s advice about not getting too attached, as she, like all children, wanted to bring the entire inventory back home. Finally, though, once Nancy had begun to tire from pushing Kiekie’s stroller around, the elder child showed an interest in the other animals that lined the wall, the puppies.

As she started to pester their guardian to let them play with one, her mother was personally having a bit of her own fun with Christine. For an explanation of what was happening, it was likely that without any other customers in the aisle, Jennifer didn’t see a reason for restraint. Letting her force the two-year-old to try out some of the accessories before making a decision. At the moment, the aunt was walking the child up and down part of the lane. Sternly pulling her forward by the leash and collar that had been hooked around the toddler’s neck, coercing the girl into cooperation under the threat of choking.

The child’s feelings were much what anyone would expect, especially once they noticed the tears beginning to dot tiles beneath her. Christine, as she had most of the time since being dropped into her tormentor’s care, was solidly hating the ordeal, as even her attempts to resist did nothing but choke her for a few moments. “Nope, assuming you still want that puppy.” Came the goaded reply, followed by their chef arriving at the table and starting a few tricks on the stove as he asked each of their orders, though he had to pause at the shock of how much they were ordering, not wanting to drop any of the food. All the more once the unlucky man saw that it was for a baby who couldn’t even talk, and began desperately ignoring the eyes the other woman had as she looked at another of the toddlers. Sadly, as the poor employee shortly realized, this wasn’t the half of it.

For the time being, though, he just did his job and was glad that at least the oldest of the children seemed to enjoy it. The child’s intent stare as he shifted the food around, making whatever shape or pattern, even a sort of egg volcano over a pile of ingredients, was enough to push her mother’s gaze out of his mind. It wasn’t very long before some of the food was ready, its maker pushing the plates toward their recipients, unknowingly forcing his young fan to shift her attention. Still, he had to pause for a moment before continuing, making sure it was alright to be paid before finishing the rest of the food, an understandable notion if you understood how much Jennifer ordered.


"I'm sorry for the trouble, but could you pay for your food now rather than after your meal? I mean no offense, but I'm sure you can understand my concern."


The mother did, but that didn't keep her from feeling slightly insulted, did she really look like someone who wouldn't pay for their food? Yet, she agreed, there wasn't any reason for her to refuse after all. So, handing over her card and signing the receipt with the provided pen, she only said a short "It's perfectly fine." in agreement.

Reassured, the chef continued his work, finally starting on the both largest and most deplorable of the orders. Feeling sick to his stomach as he cooked. The customers had a different experience, Nancy stuffing Kiekie with what of her order that’d been finished, and Rebecca herself chowing down with surprising gusto, enjoying both the meal and show. As for the baby, she, in contrast, may not have even registered that something was happening in front of her. Aside from it involving food, of course. Finally, regarding Jennifer and her own pet, the woman was getting a kick out of the server’s squirming, especially since he had no way of avoiding it. Running her hands around the poor child’s body and even choking her by the collar she was wearing whenever she tried to escape. It only got worse once the unlucky worker started serving them portions of their order.

Explaining how was simple, the mother called Rebecca over to her as soon as the child was done with her food. Beginning to instruct her on what to do. Things like “Just force as much food into her mouth as you can, if she can resist, she can eat,” and “If she resists, just do this for a little while,” before pulling the collar tight, choking the toddler for a short while with no motive outside of explanation. After that, it was the five-year-old’s free reign, though she was informed there’d be punishment if she gave her cousin an easy time.

So, having moved her chair closer to her cousin’s, Rebecca got started, picking a plate as she let out a shaking order,

“Don’t make this any harder than it has to be. Eat!” Attempting to shove a forkful of the dish into Christine’s mouth.

Attempt being the key word, as Christine, despite her terribly demeaning designation, did not have the all-consuming hunger the namesake was known for. So, as the first shaky bite came closer, she simply turned away, even despite the punishment that would be waiting for her. Though the first voice she heard wasn't a complaint from her cousin, rather, it was her aunt’s admonishment of the girl.

“Rebecca, what did I tell you to do now? Show me, so I know you’ve listened.”

“O-Okay,” She quivered, bringing her hand to the collar and pulling.

“Harder! Do you think she’ll listen for a light tug?”

“N-No...” She tugged again, causing a bit more discomfort.

“Stop dawdling and do it. Do you want me to return the dog?”

“...” Silence was the only response as Rebecca finally yanked the band as she was demanded, reviving some of the strangled coughing from the younger girl, all while feeling her own stomach turn with her actions. The cheery compliments from her mother only making it worse.

“Good girl, I’m glad you’re such a good listener. Now, make sure you feed her with some force as well, not that I’ll stop you if you feel like choking her until she eats it willingly. All I want is for you to have fun with this, okay?”

“...” Again, no acknowledgment came from the five-year-old, the poor, tormented girl left to once more lift a forkful, missing one last time before she was instructed to just pull the pig’s hair in place, in addition to the collar of course.

As it continued, even Nancy was none too willing to look at it, Rebecca was pained to find that it slowly started to get a little easier in routine. Her arms began to go a bit faster, pushing more food into her victim’s mouth at a greater speed than initially. Even beginning to fall back onto strangling as an all-encompassing method of getting Christine to eat, pulling the band at progressively less provocation.

For Jennifer, she was more than pleased by the entertainment, even if she was poised to stop her daughter if she started to act out of hand. Still, she was too engrossed in the show to notice much else, even eating some of her pet swine’s meal in replacement of popcorn. The mother didn’t even realize that there might soon be a problem, as their chef was nowhere to be seen.

Jameson, despite his disagreeable personality, truly wanted what was best for all of the children he could reach. But right now, he recognized a few problems, enough that he couldn't see how any of this spectacle was counted as proper parenting? Two of them were crying for god sakes. But unfortunately, he couldn’t do too much, or anything, about it, not after his mistake last week, accidentally arresting an undercover during a drug bust. Because of that, he was forced to keep from any decisions his superiors would deem rash, even if his own experience knew they were the right ones.


Still, none of that would mean he’d stop trying, for now, he decided to use one of his cards, even if he wasn’t certain of the truth of it. “Alright, but if I could say a word of advice, it may be a good idea for you and your family to get an appointment with one of the CPS offices. Since a good opinion with them might keep you from wasting time in situations like this.”


Sitting there, Jennifer, after ordering Rebecca to continue with the spectacle, agreed, lying through her teeth of course, “Thank you for the suggestion, I’ll be sure to look into it once I’m free. But for now, I’d like to finish the meal with my family, is that alright?”


“Of course, I just wanted to help. I’ll be on my way now, what was your name again? So I can finish the report.”


“Jennifer.”


“My mistake, full name please.”


Slightly irritated from the delay, she repeated herself, “Jennifer, Jennifer Hill.”


“Thank you, I’ll be on my way then.” With that and a plainly apologetic look toward the children, he walked away, pulling his subordinate along with him. Though even as they drove away, he was busy trying to think of how to get back in the higher-ups' good graces, Jameson obviously needed to regain their trust if he was to do anything.


Happily watching them leave, the suspected mother looked over to check on her victims, glad to see her daughter was nearly finished with their piglet, they had to get on with their day after all. But that didn’t mean it was too urgent, the only thing they truly had to do before returning home was to pick up some groceries, another chance she had to tyrannize her niece in public. Smiling, she thought about how she’d be walking the child throughout the store, wondering how many would comment on the leash she was using.

For now, though, there was still something she wanted to do where she was, so hefting the overfull child onto her lap, she started enjoying her own share of the toddler. Christine, for what it was, didn’t much care, though that was likely more due to her overfull stupor than pure consent. So Jennifer was free to pinch, rub, and feel her pet’s bloated waist as she pleased, enjoying not just the child’s body, but every other customer’s looks and glances as well. There were still quite a few comments, disbelief at the lack of action on the officers’ part, not to mention at the gall the offender herself had, going right back to her spectacle as soon as the two had left.

As for Rebecca, she just stood there, the joy of her puppy crushed by the remorse of her actions, not to mention the police. The five-year-old had always heard that the force upheld the law and fought crime, so isn’t the only conclusion left that her mother was in the right doing what she has? What other reason would there be for them to ignore her and her companions’ plight? Of course, the child didn’t know the real reason, but how could she? The officer had made sure there was no indication of what he actually intended to do, and that silence did its part to crush what little hope the girl had left.

In Kiekie and her caretaker’s case, the glutton probably hadn’t even realized what was going on, hungrily looking for more food due to the break-in her feeding. And after that, with no more meals being pushed into her wondering face, the girl wasn’t too pleased to find that those meager efforts didn’t change anything, still not getting any food as she continued. Not yet realizing that there simply wasn’t any, though it wasn’t clear whether the baby would care about that problem. And Nancy was stuck searching for an alternative, hoping she’d find one before the one-year-old started crying, making even more of a spectacle than those around them.

All in all, the scene was, for all the other parents still in the building, horrifying. Really, what other response could they be expected to have? Watching the mother force her own daughters to feed each other against their will, and even caressing the body of the one no older than two in an almost sexual way. For a good few of the diners, it was too much, rushing to pay and leave unless they were stuck looking between the group and their own children, most with some variation of shock or disgust on their faces. So, time dragged on, some leaving, some gawking, yet others wondering if the police actually did their jobs, but regardless, something had to happen eventually.

A short moment later, everyone, including the now sleeping baby, was in the car, though Nancy wasn’t sure where her friend planned to go. Yes, they needed groceries, but who’s to say Jennifer didn’t have another stop in mind? They did just buy a puppy for whatever the reason, not that she was against seeing Rebecca’s mood brighten a tad as she played with the canine. Still, she had to ask, hoping the response wouldn’t be as rude as it had been the first time.


“Well, where are we going now? Groceries? Or have you thought of something else?”


“Groceries will be in a short while; I want to get our growing pet a few more accessories first, maybe something for Rebecca as well.”


“So, we’re getting clothes then?”


“Yes, may as well have some variety while I show her off. Still, I’ll have to decide what looks best for our trip to the store. There’ll be plenty of people to see her new outfit after all.”


“Of course, and would it be alright if I stay in the car while you three shop? I should watch Kiekie in case she gets up, not to mention, I feel a bit bad for the pup being left in the car alone despite just getting adopted. So, I may as well keep it company for the moment.”


“Sure, it isn’t like they can run off, one’s leashed to me, and the other loves their puppy too much to try any sort of escape.”


“Alright, well, make sure to call me if you need any help. And don’t forget to grab some clothes for the lump, your daughter’s a bit too gluttonous to fit in anything for long you know.”


“I will don’t worry.” Was the final response, its speaker soon shifting to a mumble as she tried to decide what she wanted to dress her pet in, “...what to get... a skirt? ...maybe...”


While it happened, Rebecca hardly noticed the conversation, much too busy hugging and petting the not so little ball of fur. Though whether it was more out of her personal love of the pup, or out of her need to distract herself from what she’d just done and felt was uncertain. But for the moment, the five-year-old just focused on enjoying herself, temporarily pretending she had a regular life, that she had gotten the dog for some normal occasion, instead of as payment to force her cousin full of food whenever her mother ordered.


Unfortunately, though much of the last few months could be described as such, the time girl and pup had together was soon cut short, the car stopping in an open space. With that, Jennifer soon exited the vehicle once she’d parked, opening one of the backdoors to pull out her niece, and made sure her daughter knew she wasn’t being left behind.


“Rebecca dear, come on out so we can get on with the day. I can come over and open the door for you if you’d like.”


“I can’t stay with the puppy mom?”


“You can play with them more once we get home, I want to see if we can get any new outfits for you.” Jennifer explained, adding, “Ones that’ll go better with you and your cousin’s new activity.”


“Oh...” Disappointed, the toddler unbuckled, hopping out from the now opened door before turning to her mother, “What’re we getting?”


“Well, we’ll see when we get inside won’t we, but don’t worry, you can pick out some things you want too.”


“Okay.”


With that and it’s slightly more positive tone, Jennifer walked the two girls in the door, making sure she directed the toddlers once they got inside. Now, it wasn’t forceful dragging, well, not for one of them, but it did the job, getting Rebecca to walk while her cousin crawled to their first destination. To anyone, it would be plain to assume that the reason they stopped in that section was for Christine, why wouldn’t the girl’s master want to get them some lingerie? Even if she hadn’t decided whether there’d be any actual clothes for the two-year-old to wear yet. For the moment though, she left her daughter with a single demand.


“Now Rebecca, look around here and pick out a few you think you like, I give them each a check once I’ve finished with our piglet. Alright?”


Sighing, the five-year-old gave their begrudging answer as they started the search, “Fine...”


“Good, I’ll give you some time for shirts and such after this, so don’t worry about that.”


Turning down, and lifting her pet into her arms, she continued, “Now, what’ll look best on you? Hmmm?”


Carrying the girl, Jennifer started her browsing, repeatedly forcing her plaything to stand while she compared how the patterns would look on her body. Though, it had to be admitted that the aunt thought most of the possibilities would look enticing, or more so than she already felt the toddler’s body to be. Sadly, Christine, even though she’d digested to a point during the drive, didn’t react as well as her abuser, not understanding the rubbing and squeezing her body got as it was compared to the strange fabric in front of her. Not to mention the breathy whispers that came down the two-year-old's neck, reminding the girl she was most likely doomed to outgrow whatever outfit she was bought within the next few months.


On the other hand, Rebecca was enjoying herself a little more than she expected, finding that she actually liked some of the patterns available, even if not so much the idea of showing it off. Still, the child had a few variations put aside, becoming expectably curious about how they’d feel to wear, rather than just look at. That wonderment left a little confusion with it as well, but for the most part, she just focused on ignoring it, not wanting her mother to know her feelings. Shaking it off, the redhead went back to picking, easily finding another one she liked the look of, she just wasn’t sure how long her mother would be taking.


As it was, the woman was too busy enjoying herself to pay her own daughter much attention, not that Jennifer herself was against moving to the next step. She very much did want to see the two girls try on their selections, almost enough that she forwent the dressing room in regards to the little one in front of her. So, looking again at her selections, the aunt considered which one she wanted to start with.

"Yeah... why not?"

The words echoed in Rebecca's addled brain. What Emily had told her made perfect sense, at least logically. Some people like it when other people are fat, and they can be happy together. Fine. She could understand that.

But what she couldn't understand is how.

Even though Rebecca was very, very young, Rebecca had learned some things about fat. One, that it was bad. TV shows, Barbie dolls, even the commercials made for adults that she didn't entirely understand all hammered the message home that being fat was very bad- that it made you ugly, stupid, wrong. Rebecca simply could not believe that anybody could love it outside of a sick, twisted manner like her mother did. That was the second thing- her mother. Over the past few weeks she had taught Rebecca that eating was a terrible thing, one that imparted no joy and no happiness into anybody but her sick mother and her twisted friend (perhaps Kiekie too, but she was too young to ask.) So, to Rebecca, food was bad, eating was bad, fat was bad (but somehow good, as her mother liked it) and there was no love in fattening- only force.

But now, Emily, her new, best, and only friend, was saying something completely different; that fat was pretty, and food did not need to be forced, and that people could love and respect each other at any size without pain or suffering. Rebecca wanted to believe this. Oh, she wanted to. She wanted Emily to be her friend, and like her, and maybe love her, and perhaps even get fat for her...

But she was scared. A large part of Rebecca's brain was telling her that it was a lie, it must be a lie, that if your mother didn't even love you then of course nobody else could, that fat was bad and it always will be bad and nobody will ever care about you...

"Um..."

Rebecca gasped and looked up at Emily again, expecting to see her mad- she had been thinking, of course, and not at all paying attention to her new friend. But Emily was not mad, not at all. In fact, she was smiling, a big, broad smile that stretched across her little face and seemed almost to extend off the edges of it.

Seeing the women, not to mention the obscenely fat baby next to them, Carmen wasn’t initially sure what to make of the situation. But, thanks to her training, she could apply what she’d do for somewhat similar circumstances, first and foremost being to contact the child’s guardian or parent.

“I’m sorry to trouble you two, but I have to make sure this little girl isn’t distraught for a good reason. Is that alright?”

Hiding her annoyance, Jennifer graciously replied, “Of course, what would you like to know?”

“Thank you for understanding. Which of you is her mother?”

“That’d be me, though, in reality, I’m her aunt. I’m taking care of her while her parents enjoy their vacation to Africa.”

“Ah, well, would it be alright to call them? You can check the time to make sure it isn’t anything unreasonable.”

“Sure, one moment,” The mother assented, calmly finding how appropriate it’d be to call, “It’d be quite late, but there’s a chance they’ll answer. Call them then?”

“Please.”

Dialing the number, Jennifer waited through the tones, surprised when someone actually picked up, a tired “Hello?” coming through the speaker.

“Hi, sorry to call you this late, but there was a small issue with Christine. Now, don’t worry, she’s fine, she just wandered off while we were at the beach and a nice policewoman found her. Is it alright if I hand her the phone so you can certify that your daughter is in my care?”

Moments later, an “Okay.” came in response from the device, though it wasn't without a hint of worry.

Taking the offered phone, Carmen politely got to the point, “Hello there, I’m Carmen, an average police officer. I wanted to talk to you about your daughter, she seems terrified of your sister, do you know of any reason why?”

“...No, nothing comes to mind. Could it be because she doesn’t want to be away from us for so long?”

“Maybe, but she said something about her aunt fattening her up, as absurd as it sounds.”

“Oh,” He started, suddenly glad there was a phone between him and the officer, he couldn’t bluff his way out of his smile after all. “I think I know what that’s about, she said something similar once while she was with us. She just doesn’t understand that eating so much leads her to gain weight, so after satisfying her appetite for a few days or weeks she suddenly notices she’s not as thin as before, usually we keep her on a stricter meal plan to avoid the hassle, but I guess I forgot to remind my sister.”

Hearing this, Carmen couldn’t help but let out a sigh of relief, anyone would be happy to believe the whole thing was a misunderstanding after all. “Sorry about that.” She mentioned as she handed the phone back to Jennifer, turning to the toddler before she left, “It’s okay, your parents will be back before you know it, they’ll make sure you’re back to normal in an instant.”

After giving a brief goodbye, the officer left, leaving Christine to the whims of her now oh so irritated aunt. Thankfully, the woman was still occupied for the moment. As for what, it was obviously the phone call, Jennifer waiting for her brother to finish whatever he was doing on his end before she started speaking, “Well, how's your vacation been?”

“It’s been great so far, the scenery and culture are as interesting as you’d expect, and the people are surprisingly hospitable. How about you? How large have you gotten her?”

Chuckling, she teased, “Straight to the point, aren’t we? Well, admittedly, we haven’t weighed them in a while, but she should be around ninety pounds, give or take a few. I’m not planning to stop with her, though, that wouldn’t be fair to my own daughters after all.”

“Alright, I wouldn’t mind her larger. Could you send me a picture, though? My imagination isn’t its best at my age.”

“Of course, do you care about whether she’s crying or such? Since she isn’t exactly enjoying the process.”

“Whatever’s fine.”

“Okay, I’ll take it now, don’t hang up once I’ve put you on hold though.”

“Sure.” Richard agreed, happy to see what’s been done to his daughter while he’s been away.

Moving her phone to fit all of Christine in the frame, Jennifer proudly took the picture. Not to mention another of her daughter, Kiekie, as a bit of a bonus for her sibling. Sending the photos, she returned to talking with Robert, complaining about how much of a problem her other daughter was being.

“Well, you should get them within the next few minutes, assuming you haven’t gotten them already, that is. But unfortunately, it isn’t all going well, with Rebecca refusing to cooperate at every chance. Honestly, I’m starting to wonder whether I should just keep her bound for however many days it takes for her to break, but would you have any other ideas?”

“Yeah, they’ve arrived, thanks for the pleasant surprise tonight. As for your daughter, do whatever you feel is best, I just want you to remember that we don’t want our ‘little’ Christine to have any chance of getting anywhere on her own.”

Letting out a surprisingly feminine giggle at the remark, Jennifer agreed, omitting the mention of her own, more twisted methods. “Of course I know that, and really, she should be broken by the end of the month, today’s incident put quite a strain on her after all. But I do have to get back to them after all. So despite how pleasant it is to talk with you, I have to go. Feel free to call whenever you want an update.”

“Sure, and thanks for doing all this in the first place. Bye.”

“None needed, I should be thanking you for the opportunity. I’ll call again by the end of the week to mention our progress.” Ending the call, Jennifer turned back to her companions, giving Christine a glare that made her regret even thinking about running away, let alone how she felt about actually trying to.

It was a good day for a walk, all things considered. The sun was shining, the birds were singing, the clouds were fluffy and light. All of this meant that a lot of people were out there, enjoying the weather and each other's company. All throughout the streets, couples were walking hand in hand.

The little family of our story was no exception.

Emily and Rebecca led the "charge", so to speak, small hands wrapped in a sweaty embrace. Every so often, the two little lovebirds would steal glances at each other, smiling gleefully each time they saw that their partner was still very much there, very much real. Emily almost had to look twice each time - once at Rebecca's happy face and once at her swelling body, even now spilling out of some much-undersized clothes. Her small potbelly - although not so small now as it once was - flopped over her waistband, which itself was straining with the burden of hips large enough to make the little girl waddle ever so slightly, occasionally bumping into Emily as she did so - which made both little girls very happy. As well it should.

Behind that couple walked Jennifer and Christine, the latter ensconced safely in the arms of the former. To tell the truth, Jennifer was finding it more and more difficult to carry Christine's increasing mass, but she had resolved herself to do it until she no longer could. For one thing, it would provide a real measure of the little girl's progress, and for another, Christine was just so pleasant to feel. Every day more and more squish made it on to her little frame, and every day Jennifer was happier and happier. Christine, on the other hand, was just happy to be safe and warm. She hated the feeding - who wouldn't - but, when her aunt was nice, she loved her to bits. As it was now.

In the back, last but certainly not least, walked Nancy pushing Kiekie in a large stroller. As the proportionally heaviest member of the family, Kiekie was ill-suited to being carried, both for her own sake - too much hang - and for her potential carrier - too much weight. It was therefore much simpler that she be transported in some kind of vehicle; one, Nancy realized, that she would probably need for the rest of her life. It struck her then that Kiekie would likely never walk on her own, or even at all. The thought made her smile. Down below, Kiekie slept, and dreamed of food. It was idyllic.

At least, idyllic within the family. To the many passers-by, it looked rather less so.

For one, there was the simple matter that the family hadn't rightly left the confines of home in a very long time. As such, they were pale, much paler than the average city-goer had any right to be. Pale, unkempt, and unwashed, with fat bulging out of clothes at every turn, they were an odd, unwelcome sight.

And then there was the matter of the children.

Rebecca, despite being the lightest, was herself clinically obese, a child that would not look at all out of place on something such as Maury. Christine, reposing in her aunt's warm arms, was less obvious, but still looked enormous even from that sheltering angle. And finally, for those unlucky few that peeked at Kiekie's carriage, all they saw was a formless blob of baby, wheezing mightily even at such a tender age - a truly horrific sight for anyone with a shred of decency.

Many of these passersby considered calling DCF. Some even took out their phones, Googled the number, and nearly pressed the button. All of them, universally, decided that "No, somebody else would do it," and went on their way, the fat family fading from their minds as they went on. By evening, they were gone, a forgotten bit of the conscience of the city. Invisible despite their conspicuousness.

However, in the park, things would likely be different. Especially considering the lake, and the fact that Jennifer, ever pragmatic, had packed swimsuits.

Now, a sight like that - how could they be forgotten then?

“Great, now, I’ll ask again, how are we moving her?”

Slightly surprising the two, Rebecca had an idea, “Could we try to get her onto a cushion and then slide her down the stairs? Maybe that could work.”

Momentarily musing over it, Nancy agreed, “It’d be easier than straining ourselves to lug her down the stairs. Assuming it’ll work, at least.”

So, having come up with a decided course of action, they started the preparations, not to say there was very much to be done. Sure, they had to find suitable padding for the baby to rest on, but there was already one readily available, her crib’s mattress. With that, and a blanket to awkwardly strap it and Kiekie together, the women began the cumbersome process of sliding the contraption down the stairs.

Thankfully, the struggle was much lighter than it sounded, only requiring an occasional nudge as the cushion slid over each stair. It wasn’t a fast process, though it still continued at an adequate pace. After an exasperating fifteen minutes, it was done, only taking a few more to get her to the desired room. Once they’d gotten there, the trio noticed another issue; they didn’t have any food left in the house, not to mention they wouldn’t be able to carry “little” Kiekie inside any form of restaurant.

Obviously, that problem wasn’t about to go unmentioned, so, despite being a little vague, Rebecca piped up in true toddler fashion, “What do we do now? I’m getting kinda hungry.”

Left without the option of cartoons, Rebecca wasn’t quite sure what to spend her time doing. “What’s wrong? Come on, eat. After this, I’m sure your mother will let us come over to your house and help.”

For a moment, Rebecca just stood there, staring forward blankly from the shock of it all, but after enough prodding from the girl whose motives so resembled her mother’s she eventually gave in. The food itself wasn’t bad, a tad basic, though what would you expect from a simple sandwich, and the slight fullness it left in the poor girl’s stomach was well known to be a depressing omen for what’s to come. As soon as she'd finished the sandwich, the perpetually unfortunate girl was ushered downstairs by her ecstatic companion, almost being dragged into the kitchen where said companion’s mother was.

“Mom! I brought her; you’re almost done, right?”

“Yes dear, there’s plenty on the table all ready to get started on... and Rebecca?” Emily’s mother asked.

“Yes?”

“I’m sure you know the drill by now but, eat, because either through your own or me and my daughter’s efforts, all of this will end up in your and Emily’s stomachs.”

“...”

“Rebecca?”

“Haaaaah... Fine I guess, not as if I have a choice.”

“Good, get started.” Gesturing to the spread already on the table, the woman turned back to the stove, finishing the last of the many dishes meant for the young girls.

As for Rebecca, she didn’t know much else that she could do, so she started eating, somberly bringing bite after bite of food to her frowning face. It didn’t take much time for her to crumble though, as after a few mouthfuls, the girl couldn’t hold back the bitter tears of her disappointment, sorrow and frustration spilling down her cheeks. These feelings weren’t helped by the enthusiasm her companion had for eating; Emily’s reaction was nearly juxtaposing hers with its positivity.

At this point though, the four-year-old was having trouble finding a reason to bother resisting anymore, after all, nothing she’d done had given positive results, and it wasn’t as if she had much incentive to resist, sure she didn’t enjoy the feedings, but what could a toddler expect to accomplish anyway? Strangely enough, as the girl crumbled mentally, she started eating faster, almost as if trying to use the food as a way to smother the fear she now held for her near certain future. Nonetheless, at this point, Rebecca had well and truly given up, for what else was she to do?

As for the two other people in the room, Emily’s mother had since finished the last dish and at that point had started encouraging her daughter to eat more, who, given what she’d been taught from infancy, needed minimal prompting. But not all was going as desired, after all, Rebecca was getting a bit full, which wouldn’t do if she was ever to grow to the size she should be. There wasn’t much to be done about her capacity, other than increasing it at least, so the girl’s current captor moved from her own, all too willing child, and picked up a few dishes to force into the other.

If Rebecca noticed the woman moving over to her, the four-year-old didn’t react, though it seemed unlikely given how meagerly lucid the child was in regards to the food pressed to her lips, those in question merely opening and closing as whatever dish was pushed against them. Even with the lack of opposition, it was still tiresome to hand-feed the girl, leading her offender to eventually get lost in her thoughts, one of them wondering just how well she and the girl’s mother will get along.

At some point, no one noticed specifically when, the feeding was over, Emily’s enthusiasm had traded itself for sloth, leading to her current state of dozing contently on the table, as for Rebecca, she too was asleep, though hers was much more fitful compared to the other girl’s, unsurprising given how much had been pushed into her gullet. There laid a slight problem though, as even though the current situation was nearly perfect, what was she to do now?

Obviously, she had to bring Rebecca back to her house soon, but would she rather feed her own butterball-in-training or let Jennifer do it for her...

15411221.content:
“Bye, Jere. We’re really sorry about pushing this onto you, but your father and I only have so many opportunities for a promotion, especially at our ages, so we want to make sure to take any chances left. Thank you for promising to take care of your sister.”


“It’s fine mom, I’m used to your trips and I know why you take them. Just to make sure I’ve got it down, she doesn’t have any allergies and isn’t picky, right?”


“Yeah, it should be easy enough for you to take care of her. Remember, if you’re letting her crawl around, make sure you’ve picked up anything small enough for her to put in her mouth, we don’t want her choking.”


“It should be fine, I’ve tidied up. You two go on ahead, call me when you get there, okay?”


“Of course, love you.”


“Love you too.” Said Jeremy, as he pulled both of his parents in for a hug goodbye.


After they left, Jeremy picked up his sister, Lucy, and brought her into the room he’d somewhat remodeled for her arrival. The room wasn’t much, it’s main fixture was the crib he's borrowing from his parents while they were on their trip, the only other things in the room were the boxes of diapers Jeremy had bought for Lucy.

At a glance nothing was amiss, but upon closer inspection, you’d notice something about the diapers, namely, they were all the wrong size, some even the largest size the store carried. The only reasons one might buy them would be if they had strangely poor eyesight, a child at that size, or reason to expect a need for them soon. Out of those options, only one made the slightest sense, there was some reason for him to expect a need for them, but what?


The answer, odd though it was, became clear enough when he pulled out a large cake and began cutting it into chunks small enough to fit into his blender, after filling the blender jar, Jeremy held down the lid and started blending the paste that would become one of the main aspects of Lucy’s diet while she was here. When there was a bit more space in the blender Jeremy stopped it, took off the lid, topped off the jar with gain shake, replaced the lid and restarted blending. Jeremy stopped the blender as soon as the mixture looked uniform, then detached the pitcher from the stand before opening a drawer and grabbing the other two things he needed, a funnel and a roll of duct tape.


After Jeremy had set out what he was about to use, he started to think about exactly what he was planning on doing, because honestly, what was he planning to do? Was there some hidden but sensible reasoning for this? No, there wasn’t, the only reason Jeremy had in defense of his future sins was paltry at best, being little more than that she’d be cuter than she was now. Originally, he’d had a half-joking thought about doing this so he could have an extra comfortable gaming chair, though that soon changed in favor of a strange perversion Jeremy had noticed in himself, he wanted Lucy to be helpless, incapable of doing anything of than eating, sleeping, etc. Even before she ended up immobile, Jeremy wanted to savor how much she’d struggle, trying to crawl even as her stomach was resting ever more so on the ground. Once Lucy was rendered immobile under her own power…


Shaking his head, Jeremy got back to the task at hand, pulling off a length of the tape with an audible SHRIIIIP, he quickly secured his unfortunate sibling. With how rough he was while binding her, it came as no surprise when Lucy woke up, soon becoming perplexed enough by the situation to start crying, accomplishing little other than granting Jeremy a sadistic pleasure in her discomfort. Deciding to take advantage of Lucy’s wailing, Jeremy wasted no delicacy shoving the funnel into her mouth, making sure it was properly taped. Once the funnel was attached, Jeremy picked up the pitcher again and started pouring the fattening liquid into the unlucky baby’s mouth, watching their throat bulge with each small, desperate swallow. As Lucy’s face slowly started to convert into an expression of abject discomfort, then pain, as Jeremy kept the flow steady, pitiless toward the overfull girl, mercilessly pinching her nose whenever her pace slowed, forcing her to take a few panicked gulps to try and get a breath of air.


After what to Lucy felt like an eternity, though in reality was only around fifteen to twenty minutes, the last dregs of the sludge her brother had forced into her had made their way through the funnel and disappeared with a final, exhausted gulp. With the pitcher emptied, Jeremy detached and removed the funnel before putting a strip of tape over Lucy’s mouth to make sure none of the mixture gets expelled. Afterward, Jeremy decides to have some fun with his overfilled sister starting to pinch, poke and prod at the swollen mass that made up Lucy’s midsection, enjoying the discomfort shown to him on his sibling’s face. Due to how rough she was being handled, Lucy had started crying again, sobbing quietly through the tape on her mouth, hoping for her brother to stop, surprisingly, he did after a quick glance at the clock. The reason was that Jeremy saw it was about time for him to put in his work for the day, leaving Lucy bound and stuffed he went to his office to put in his shift.

1541122221.content:
The media was in turmoil, as was a good portion of the country. The reason was apparent, the young Dewly heiress had been abducted, and no one had entirely figured out how. People’s theories ranged from conspiracy to it being the product of plain negligence, but the only way to actually know would be to ask the perpetrators. So why not move to their perspectives, maybe we’ll learn something…

“Hey look, we’re famous.” Said Chris, one of the abductors, pointing at one of the nearby newspaper racks, filled with papers showing a headline in large, bold letters,


“DEWLY HEIR ABDUCTED, BY WHOM? HOW?”


Looking over, Gerald, another member of the group, gave him a blunt reminder, “Of course we are. What did you expect? That no one would notice if we stole the child of one of the wealthiest families in the world?”

He gestured to the large boxes of assorted foodstuffs they’d bought after they’d set the terms of returning the girl. Instructing his partner, “Stop being an idiot and get over here so you can help me load these. The gold’s not about to make itself.”

Shaking his head, Chris conceded, hoisting a crate into the back of the old van they’d gotten before the heist. Again thinking that the other member of their group was a tad eccentric. As in all honesty, what kind of person would be able to pressure anyone into writing a ransom agreement to pay the girl’s weight in gold? Who wouldn’t take advantage of that?

Setting the last of the boxes into the van, Chris climbed inside, shutting the doors behind him and making his way to the passenger seat. Then attaching his seatbelt while Gerald started the vehicle to begin the journey back to their temporary home. Both held a bit of pity for their victim, given what they expected her to be forced to experience.

Not horribly long after that, they’d returned, the van parked at an entirely nondescript home. Its anonymity increased all the more, given that it sat on a back road. Hopping out of the vehicle, the two set to work, moving box after box inside, eventually filing a decent half of the living room. That didn’t matter much, though, as soon enough, Carla had grabbed one of the containers before moving back to her captive with a noticeably happy disposition.

Back in Anna’s room, the child was abruptly woken up and soon found that she couldn’t move any of her limbs. Before she’d registered it enough to cry, someone else spoke, seeming happy for whatever reason.

“Hey, you’re up, great. Now,” The woman started, picking up a cake from the box beside her, “open up.”

Confused, and a little hungry, she did. To her, near-immediate regret as a handful of baked good was forced into her mouth. Choking the arguably delicious mouthful down, Anna once again made the mistake of opening her mouth in an attempt to cry. And so, it started, a handful being stuffed into her at every opportunity she gave, and a pinch or poke, whenever she stopped giving said opportunities. Expectably, the two’s opinions on the activity were mirror opposites.

For Carla, there hadn’t been a happier time than this that she could remember. Her enthusiasm showed, hands forcing chunk after chunk into the girl’s face, and thus her stomach. On that point, the woman noticed that it was looking a tad tight, and, though notably disappointed, decided that it would be better to stop now. Half-jokingly thinking of how she wouldn’t get any money if the kid burst, which didn’t seem terribly farfetched at this stage.

Leaving poor Anna in her makeshift crib, Carla made her way out of the room, a small part of her hoping that her cohorts wouldn’t make a fuss if they saw the girl. After all, if not this, then how was she expected to make their fortune?
